author: rivals.com
title: Don't miss out on any of our exclusive Football and basketba
text:
Don't miss out on any of our exclusive Football and basketball coverage. Get your 30-day Free Trial today.
For the latest FSU news & coverage follow us on Twitter , Instagram & Facebook !
2/20 Entry @ 2 p.m. -- FSU 8/1 odds to win National Championship In the eyes of the oddsmakers in Las Vegas, Florida State still has a one-in-eight chance of winning the 2017 football national championship. The latest odds, released by Westgate Las Vegas Superbook via Wagertalk.com, says FSU's chances of winning the big prize have remain unchanged when the opening odds were released in January.
Alabama leads the way with a two-in-seven chance of winning a national championship. Along with FSU, Oklahoma, Ohio State and USC, all have similar odds to come out on top. Clemson, the defending national champions and FSU's main competition in the ACC, comes in at 15/1 to repeat.
2/20 Entry @ 8 a.m. -- Tarvarus McFadden's New Highlight Reel Florida State cornerback Tarvarus McFadden led the nation in interceptions as a sophomore in 2016. Yesterday the talented cover corner shared the latest reel showcasing his highlights. Watch it below:
2/19 Entry @ 7 a.m. -- Deondre Francois Throws Over PIKE House It seems a recent tradition at Florida State is for quarterbacks to show off their arm strength by tossing a football over large things. Back in early 2013 Jameis Winston, likely unknowingly, began this tradition by throwing a ball over the Pi Kappa Alpha (PIKE) fraternity house.
In 2015, Sean Maguire put his own spin on the new tradition by throwing a football over the high wall of Doak Campbell Stadium from the parking lot.
@seanmaguire_10 #TrickShotSaturday #GoNoles #GoJesus pic.twitter.com/6ere3ZYRvI
— Tyler O'Brien (@_TylerOBrien) December 12, 2015 Now current FSU starting quarterback Deondre Francois has returned to the roots of the tradition at the PIKE house and put his own stamp on the tradition Jameis Winston began over four years ago. After Winston accomplished the feat, he went on to lead FSU to a national championship. Could that mean the same for FSU and Francois in 2017?
Watch Deondre Francois throw a football over the pike house pic.twitter.com/WDc6dyVALA
— zachboivin (@ZachBoivin17) February 18, 2017
2/17 Entry @ 7 a.m. -- Dalvin Cook To Tampa Bay? Could Dalvin Cook be headed to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to join former teammate Jameis Winston in the backfield?
According to Chad Reuter of NFL.com, in his latest mock of the first 4 rounds of the 2017 NFL Draft, has Cook going 19th overall to Tampa Bay.
Reuter, who has Cook as the second running back taken in the draft behind LSU's Leonard Fournette who he has going to the Panthers 8th overall, calls Cook a, "potential all-pro."
Four-round #mockdraft !
Top talent slides with 3 QBs in top 13 picks. #Bears land QB in Round 2. https://t.co/WlGuD22BBC (via @chad_reuter ) pic.twitter.com/30UN124KuU
— CollegeFootball 24/7 (@NFL_CFB) February 16, 2017
2/16 Entry @ 7:45 p.m. -- Dalvin Cook Takes Over NFL Snapchat While Florida State star running back Dalvin Cook prepares for the 2017 NFL Draft, he had the unique opportunity of taking over the NFL's official Snapchat account today.
In the short videos you get a glimpse behind the scenes at the work Cook is putting in to prepare for late April's NFL Combine. At the conclusion of the videos, he fills fans in on what his three most prized possessions are, which look to be his FSU helmet, a game ball and his 2016 Orange Bowl MVP Trophy. Watch the videos below:
#FSU 's Dalvin Cook taking over the NFL's Snapchat while preparing for the 2017 #NFLCombine pic.twitter.com/jC77VGnxVz
— Singleshot ⚾ (@Singleshot25) February 16, 2017 2nd session with Dalvin Cook taking over the NFL Snapchat while preparing for the 2017 #NFLCombine pic.twitter.com/8OePcu9oQa
— Singleshot ⚾ (@Singleshot25) February 17, 2017
2/15 Entry @ 8 p.m. -- More Preseason Recognition on the Diamond With opening weekend on the diamond kicking off in less than 48 hours, Noles are still getting plenty of preseason recognition.
The Golden Spikes Award, one of the most prestigious awards in all of baseball awarded to amateur baseball's best regular season player, released their preseason watch list earlier today.
Of the 55 players listed on the watch list, 16 different collegiate athletic conferences are represented. The ACC and SEC lead them all with 13 players each. Florida State along with 8 other teams have a pair of players on the list. Only 3 other teams have more, with 3 each.
The two FSU players on the list are infielders Taylor Walls and Dylan Busby.
With 4 winners since the award was first presented in 1978, no college baseball program in the country has won the award more than Florida State : outfielder Mike Fuentes in 1981, pitcher Mike Loynd in 1986, outfielder J.D. Drew in 1997 and catcher Buster Posey in 2008.
D1Baseball.com released their power rankings for starting pitchers today with a trio of Noles on the list of 200. The rankings are who they say have talent, proved themselves against top competition in summer ball and look poised for a breakout year and not a ranking of pro prospects.
Cole Sands is the top FSU pitcher on the list at #63, followed by Drew Carlton at #73 and Tyler Holton at #101.
D1Baseball.com has also looked ahead to the 2018 MLB Draft and listed their top 150 sophomore prospects . On their list, Florida State and their rivals in Gainesville are the only teams to have 3 players listed in the top 30.
The highest ranked player for FSU is catcher Cal Raleigh at #9, followed by pitcher Cole Sands at #14 and finally outfielder Jackson Lueck at #27.
2/14 Entry @ 7 a.m. -- Deondre Francois Early Heisman Odds Sports Illustrated released their best value bets for the 2017 Heisman Trophy . Florida State quarterback Deondre Francois was given 14/1 odds to win the trophy based on a release by a popular betting website. Here is what Sports Illustrated had to say about Francois:
You could have made the case for betting on Francois to win the Heisman last year. Like former Florida State star Jameis Winston, Francois was taking over the Seminoles' staring quarterback job as a redshirt freshman after arriving in Tallahassee as one of the top quarterback recruits his class. Like Winston, Francois had made a really strong impression during the spring game that year. Like Winston, Francois had been engaged in a battle for the top spot on the depth chart during the summer. Yet two things quickly became clear that all but precluded Francois making a run at college sports’ most coveted individual honor. First, unlike in Winston’s Heisman-winning season, the Seminoles fell out of national championship contention over the first month of the season (losses to Louisville and North Carolina). Second, Francois had not developed into a passer of Winston’s caliber. The Seminoles were better off asking Dalvin Cook to do the heavy lifting on offense while Francois got his bearings at the controls of Jimbo Fisher’s pro-style scheme.
With an off-season to conduct the first-team offense as the unquestioned starter, Francois will enter 2017 more prepared to put up the numbers he needs to contend for the Heisman. And if the Seminoles can stay in the hunt for a playoff berth, Francois will benefit from marquee games with national championship implications.
2/12 Entry @ 3 p.m. -- Recognition Continues for Xavier Rhodes Former Florida State cornerback Xavier Rhodes has been declared the best draft pick by the Minnesota Vikings over the past five years according to Fox Sports.
According to Pro Football Focus, Rhodes led all NFL cornerbacks in run defense grades with an 86.4 which barely edged out his former teammate Ronald Darby's grade of 86.3. No other corner graded out higher than an 83.5.
Rhodes was the first of two cornerbacks who have been drafted in the 1st round during the Jimbo Fisher era when the Vikings took him with the 25th overall pick in 2013. Jalen Ramsey was the other with the 5th overall pick in 2016.
Well Worth It! @FOXSports declared Xavier Rhodes best Vikings draft pick in last 5 yrs. #1on1 #PlanetXay #VKNT pic.twitter.com/kRwn1WfP9i
— VikingNations (@VikingNations) February 12, 2017 Best run defense grades among CBs
Xavier Rhodes, MIN, 86.4
Ronald Darby, BUF, 86.3
Brent Grimes, TB, 83.5
Aqib Talib, DEN, 83.2 pic.twitter.com/AeNOltuhZW
— Pro Football Focus (@PFF) February 12, 2017
